com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Class BaseFeatureLayer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseLayer
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseDatasetLayer
              |
              +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseFeatureLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, DatasetLayer, FeatureLayer, Layer, Searchable, Selectable, SelectableLayer
public class BaseFeatureLayer
extends BaseDatasetLayer
implements FeatureLayer

A standard implementation of the FeatureLayer object. It manages the drawing of a FeatureClass by preparing and passing a MapQuery to the associated Renderer. The Renderer uses the passed Query to search the FeatureClass.

See Also:
MapFilter

          The default selection color is yellow.

drawFilter

protected void drawFilter(BaseSpatialFilter filter,
                          Graphics2D gctxt,
                          int phase)
                   throws InterruptedException
Description copied from class: BaseDatasetLayer
Sub-classes must implement this method in order to take advantage of the implementation of the BaseLayer.draw, and BaseDatasetLayer.drawWithinScale methods. A preliminary MapFilter is already created, and the Graphics2D on which to render is created by drawWithinScale. All the subclass implementation has to do is query the associated Dataset for data, then render it to the Graphics2D.

Specified by:
drawFilter in class BaseDatasetLayer
Parameters:
filter - the MapFilter with pre-built spatial relation
gctxt - the Graphics2D on which to render
phase - the draw phase
InterruptedException

public void setDefinition(SelectionSet newDefinition)
Description copied from interface: FeatureLayer
Applies the given SelectionSet to this FeatureLayer. Only those Features defined by the SelectionSet are drawn.

Specified by:
setDefinition in interface FeatureLayer
Parameters:
newDefinition - the new Selection definition, null = clear the definition
